Detailed Description

Generic mathing routines.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum base36_error_codes

Describes error codes passed by base36tobase10().

Enumerator:
BASE36_OK  Everything is OK
BASE36_INVALID_CHAR  An invalid character was encountered

Function Documentation

int base10tobase36 ( int64_t  base10,
char *  buffer,
int  size 
)

Converts a base 10 integer to base36.

Parameters:
base10 A base 10 integer
[out] buffer A pointer to an allocated buffer to store the base36 string.
size The length of the buffer.
Returns:
0 on success, nonzero if the buffer wasn't large enough or there was another problem.

int64_t base36tobase10 ( char *  base36,
int  length 
)

Converts a string with a base 36 number to a base 10 number.

Parameters:
base36 A string containing a base 36 number
length The length of the base 36 number
Returns:
The base 10 number.
Use of the length parameter allows you to extract a base 10 number from a string in place, so no string copying is required.

int modulo ( int  number,
int  divisor 
)

Performs a modulo between two numbers.

Parameters:
number The number whose remainder you want
divisor The number to divide by
Returns:
The remainder of the division, unoptimized by the compiler

uint64_t uint64_ror ( uint64_t  number,
int  count 
)

Performs a bitwise rotate right.

Parameters:
number The number to manipulate
count The number of times to rotate right
Returns:
Number rotated right "count" times
